intro: Oenothera hookeri subsp. hirsutissima, commonly known as the hirsute evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its subspecific name "hirsutissima." The plant produces showy yellow flowers that open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Oenothera hookeri subsp. hirsutissima is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other evening primrose species.
